result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to have no contact with I.M.O.M.

10:22 AM Defendant Luis Rivera Diaz in court.  Attorney Sylvie Dahnert in court for Luis Rivera Diaz.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by phone. Interpreter S.R. appears in person, sworn in. State advised possible resolution, not yet there, information provided that needs to be reviewed and discussed with victim. STC set. Defense request to address bond conditions.  Defense makes argument. State makes argument. Victim makes statement. Court amends bond.
Status Conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status Conference on November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Attorney Dahnert advised defendant waives reading of information and enters NG pleas. PTC/STC set. Bond cont.

2:42 PM Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Luis Rivera Diaz in court.  Attorney Sylvie Dahnert appeared by video for Luis Rivera Diaz. Interpreter S.R. appears in person, sworn in. Def wishes to waive right to PH. Court advised def right to PH. Def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for further proceedings. Information filed. Atty Dahnert states def waives reading of information and enters NG plea. PTC/STC set. Defense request to address condition of bond, wants to set bond hearing. Court requests defense to file motion and hearing will be set.  Bond to continue.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status Conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status Conference on October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Luis Rivera Diaz in court.  Attorney Sylvie Dahnert in court for Luis Rivera Diaz. Interpreter S.R. appears in person, sworn in.  Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Defendant KVI waives time limits.  PH set.  Bond cont.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Dahnert requested the 7/19/22 hearing be rescheduled in order to take the court appointment. DA's office does not object. Court approved request.

Court advised defendant of right to counsel. Defendant advised filled out paperwork for counsel. Court moves to reschedule. INIT set. Bond cont.
